text: Dear Otto, new mod_harbour example callphp.prg

elements.text: Dear Otto, new mod_harbour example callphp.prg

text:
#ifdef __PLATFORM__WINDOWS   #include "c:\harbour\contrib\hbcurl\<http://hbcurl.ch|hbcurl.ch>"#else   #include "/home/user/harbour/contrib/hbcurl/hbcurl.ch"#endif

function Main()

  ? "Hello world"

  ? callPHP( "<http://www.fivetechsoft.com/getip.php|www.fivetechsoft.com/getip.php>" )

return nil

function callPHP( cUrl )

   local uValue

   curl_global_init()

   if ! empty( hCurl := curl_easy_init() )
        curl_easy_setopt( hCurl, HB_CURLOPT_URL, cUrl )
        curl_easy_setopt( hCurl, HB_CURLOPT_DL_BUFF_SETUP )

        if curl_easy_perform( hCurl ) == 0
           uValue = curl_easy_dl_buff_get( hCurl )
        endif
   endif

   curl_global_cleanup()

return uValue

elements.text:
#ifdef __PLATFORM__WINDOWS   #include "c:\harbour\contrib\hbcurl\hbcurl.ch"#else   #include "/home/user/harbour/contrib/hbcurl/hbcurl.ch"#endif

function Main()

  ? "Hello world"

  ? callPHP( "
www.fivetechsoft.com/getip.php

" )

return nil

function callPHP( cUrl )

   local uValue

   curl_global_init()

   if ! empty( hCurl := curl_easy_init() )
        curl_easy_setopt( hCurl, HB_CURLOPT_URL, cUrl )
        curl_easy_setopt( hCurl, HB_CURLOPT_DL_BUFF_SETUP )

        if curl_easy_perform( hCurl ) == 0
           uValue = curl_easy_dl_buff_get( hCurl )
        endif
   endif

   curl_global_cleanup()

return uValue

text: I assumed Otto was asking about running PHP code inline, which isn't possible right now

elements.text: I assumed Otto was asking about running PHP code inline, which isn't possible right now

text: I guess you can use child process functions to call the PHP interpreter if you need to run PHP code that can't be accessible from outside the server, but that's not running it inline.

elements.text: I guess you can use child process functions to call the PHP interpreter if you need to run PHP code that can't be accessible from outside the server, but that's not running it inline.

text: About whether it'd be ever possible to do that, I doubt it but I haven't looked into how different Apache modules can interact.

elements.text: About whether it'd be ever possible to do that, I doubt it but I haven't looked into how different Apache modules can interact.

text: You can also run it using javascript as "inline" code

elements.text: You can also run it using javascript as "inline" code

Se me ocurre una situación rara donde igual estaría justificado tirar un cgi desde el proceso de harbour para heredar los permisos, pero es más retorcido de la cuenta.

 Normalmente haces un fetch() desde javascript y acabas rápido

Y si lo tienes muy complicado porque CORS y cosas así te amargan la existencia, o tienes que manipular la salida antes de despacharla, pues el ejemplito de Antonio con curl va de perlas

text: One common test I see for lot of compilers is Eratosthenes's sieve   ( <https://gist.github.com/kgaughan/1932132> ) another can be retrieve records from a mysql table, both on same machine of course

elements.text: One common test I see for lot of compilers is Eratosthenes's sieve   (
) another can be retrieve records from a mysql table, both on same machine of course

anyway the code will be simple to port

text: Thank you. And then I will test MySQL against DBF.

text: In that case you'd be testing the databases' performance, not the performance of the languages.

elements.text: In that case you'd be testing the databases' performance, not the performance of the languages.

text: The tests need to be as close as possible to be reliable, so that the only difference is the language's runtime.

elements.text: The tests need to be as close as possible to be reliable, so that the only difference is the language's runtime.

text: You can then use mod_harbour to compare both databases if that's something you care about.

elements.text: You can then use mod_harbour to compare both databases if that's something you care about.

text: Although for comparing the databases, you should do tests across a whole range of sizes and stuff.

elements.text: Although for comparing the databases, you should do tests across a whole range of sizes and stuff.

text: Maybe for the languages too, since I believe PHP has some JIT, so it performance would improve the more you run it in the same server instance.

elements.text: Maybe for the languages too, since I believe PHP has some JIT, so it performance would improve the more you run it in the same server instance.
